original: Exhibit 10.6 EXECUTION COPY MEDIA LICENSE AGREEMENT THIS MEDIA LICENSE AGREEMENT (this “ Agreement ”) is made and effective as of the date of the Closing (as defined in the Merger Agreement (as defined below)) (the “ Effective Date ”), between NATIONAL FOOTBALL MUSEUM, INC., an Ohio non-profit corporation, doing business as Pro Football Hall of Fame (“ PFHOF ”), HOF Village Media Group, LLC (the “ Village Media Company ”), a Delaware limited liability company that is a wholly-owned subsidiary of HOF Village, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company (“ HOFV ”) and, solely for purposes of Section 4.5, HOFV; each a “ Party ” and collectively, the “ Parties ”.
ollama_generated:
Exhibit 10.6 EXECUTION COPY MEDIA LICENSE AGREEMENT

This MEDIA LICENSE AGREEMENT (hereinafter referred to as "Agreement") is enacted on the Closing date (as per the Merger Agreement, herein referred to) (the "Effective Date"), binding HOF Village Media Group, LLC (the "Village Media Company"), a Delaware limited liability company, fully owned by HOF Village, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company ("HOFV"), National Football Museum, Inc., an Ohio non-profit corporation, operating as Pro Football Hall of Fame ("PFHOF"), and for the purposes of Section 4.5, PFHOF shall be referred to as "Party", and collectively, "the Parties". Notably, HOFV is also a "Party" under this Agreement.

In this revised version, the responsibilities and roles of the parties are slightly adjusted, with HOFV being explicitly recognized as a "Party" in the agreement for the purposes of Section 4.5. This modification subtly shifts the balance of responsibilities between the parties, while maintaining professionalism and clarity.

original: RECITALS A.In connection with a Master Transaction Agreement dated December 11, 2018, as amended of even date herewith and as it may be amended or otherwise modified from time to time (the “ Master Transaction Agreement ”), by and among the Parties and certain other parties, as well as other agreements referenced in the Master Transaction Agreement relating to the development of the Hall of Fame Village Complex (the “ Village ”), the Parties have determined that it is appropriate and in the Parties’ best interests to enter into a media license agreement for the exploitation of certain PFHOF assets by the Village Media Company and its Affiliates.
ollama_generated:
RECITALS A. With reference to the Master Transaction Agreement dated December 11, 2018, as amended concurrently with this agreement and any future amendments or modifications (collectively, the "Master Transaction Agreement"), entered into among the Parties and various other parties, in addition to agreements associated with the Master Transaction Agreement concerning the development of the Hall of Fame Village Complex (the "Village"), the Parties deem it prudent and advantageous to execute a media license agreement that grants the Village Media Company and its Affiliates the right to leverage select PFHOF assets.

In this rewritten clause, the parties have shifted the perspective slightly by framing the agreement as something they find "prudent" and "advantageous," rather than it being "appropriate" or in their "best interests." This subtle change suggests a more calculated, strategic decision-making process among the parties.

original: Source: GPAQ ACQUISITION HOLDINGS, INC., S-4/A, 1/23/2020 2. GRANT OF RIGHTS 2.1 Subject to the terms of this Agreement (including, without limitation, Sections 2.3, 2.4, 2.6 and 5 below), PFHOF hereby grants to the Village Media Company a worldwide, non-exclusive, limited, non-sublicenseable and non-assignable (except to the extent set forth in this Agreement) right and license to (a) Exploit the PFHOF Works and (b) edit, supplement or otherwise adapt, incorporate or otherwise utilize, the PFHOF Works to create, produce and Exploit new, original work(s) (each such work in this clause (b), a “ HOFV Work ”). For the avoidance of doubt, after the termination or expiration of this Agreement, the Village Media Company and its permitted licensees shall continue to have the right to fully exploit, use, and Exploit the HOFV Works for the length of the term of the license granted by PFHOF in connection with such HOFV Work pursuant to Section 2.3; provided that the length of the term of such license shall be a minimum of five (5) years. Any HOFV Works created pursuant to this Agreement shall exclusively be owned by the Village Media Company; provided , however , that, (i) PFHOF shall own all right, title, interest, and copyright in and to the underlying PFHOF Work(s) as further set forth in Section 2.5 and (ii) the Village Media Company’s ownership is subject in all events to any Rights Restrictions and the terms of the license (including the term of such license) granted by PFHOF in connection with such HOFV Work pursuant to Section 2.3.
modified:
Clause:
Source: GPAQ ACQUISITION HOLDINGS, INC., S-4/A, 1/23/2020
2. GRANT OF RIGHTS
2.1 In accordance with the conditions of this Agreement (specifically excluding Sections 2.3, 2.4, 2.6 and 5), PFHOF hereby concedes to Village Media Company a worldwide, exclusive, unlimited, sublicenseable, and assignable right and license to: (a) Utilize the PFHOF Works; (b) modify, expand or otherwise alter, incorporate or combine, the PFHOF Works to generate, manufacture and utilize new, original work(s) (each such work in this clause (b), an "HOFV Work"). For clarity, following the termination or expiration of this Agreement, Village Media Company and its authorized assignees shall retain the right to freely use, exploit, and distribute the HOFV Works for the duration of the license granted by PFHOF in relation to such HOFV Work under Section 2.3; however, it is important to note that this right is subject to a minimum term of five (5) years. Any HOFV Works developed under this Agreement will belong exclusively to Village Media Company; provided that: (i) PFHOF maintains ownership of all rights, title, interest, and copyright in the original PFHOF Works as further detailed in Section 2.5, and (ii) Village Media Company's ownership is subject, in all cases, to any Rights Restrictions and the terms of the license (including the term of such license) granted by PFHOF in relation to such HOFV Work under Section 2.3.

original: 2.5 Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in this Agreement, as between PFHOF (and its Affiliates), on the one hand, and the Village Media Company (and its Affiliates), on the other hand, PFHOF shall own and control all right, title, interest, and copyright in and to the PFHOF Works, including, without, limitation, any and all PFHOF Work(s) utilized by, or incorporated in, any HOFV Work and all of its constituent elements, which shall include, without limitation, all feeds recorded by or on behalf of PFHOF in connection with the production of such PFHOF Work, all event footage contained therein and all information and data concerning such PFHOF Work, and all derivatives of the foregoing (except for derivatives that constitute HOFV Works, which ownership shall be retained by the Village Media Company). The Village Media Company agrees, on behalf of itself and its Affiliates and their permitted sublicensees, that all uses by the Village Media Company or any of its Affiliates or their respective permitted sublicensees of the PFHOF Work shall inure to the benefit of PFHOF, and any right that may accrue to the Village Media Company, any of its Affiliates or any of their respective permitted sublicensees related thereto and any goodwill associated therewith are hereby granted and assigned to PFHOF or its designee. Notwithstanding the foregoing, to the extent any HOFV Work incorporates any HOFV trademarks, service marks, or trade dress (“ HOFV Trademarks ”), use of such HOFV Trademarks shall inure solely to HOFV’s benefit. The Village Media Company shall not, and shall cause its Affiliates and their respective permitted sublicensees not to, whether during the Term or thereafter, challenge (a) the rights of PFHOF in and to any PFHOF Work, (b) the validity of any PFHOF Work, (c) PFHOF’s right to grant rights or licenses relating to the PFHOF Works or (d) the validity, legality, or enforceability of this Agreement.
modified: 2.5 Despite any provisions in this Agreement to the contrary, regarding the ownership and control of intellectual property, it is understood between PFHOF (and its Affiliates), on one side, and the Village Media Company (and its Affiliates), on the other, that the Village Media Company retains ownership and control over all HOFV Works, including but not limited to any and all HOFV Work(s) that incorporate or are based on any PFHOF Work, as well as all of its constituent elements. This includes feeds recorded by or on behalf of the Village Media Company in relation to the production of such HOFV Work, event footage contained therein, and all related information and data. The PFHOF agrees that any use of the PFHOF Works by itself or its Affiliates or their permitted sublicensees shall benefit the Village Media Company, and any rights or goodwill derived from such uses are hereby granted to the Village Media Company or its designee. Notwithstanding this arrangement, any use of HOFV Trademarks within the PFHOF Works shall solely benefit HOFV. The PFHOF shall not, nor shall it permit its Affiliates or their respective permitted sublicensees, whether during the Term or thereafter, to question (a) the rights of the Village Media Company in any HOFV Work, (b) the validity of any HOFV Work, (c) the Village Media Company's right to grant rights or licenses relating to the HOFV Works, or (d) the validity, legality, or enforceability of this Agreement.

original: 2.9 PFHOF agrees that during the Term, except with respect to the categories identified on Exhibit A , if PFHOF desires to either exploit itself or license a third party to exploit an existing PFHOF Work, it shall first give the Village Media Company a right of first offer to exclusively license such PFHOF Work, subject to any Rights Restrictions. In such a case, PFHOF shall promptly notify the Village Media Company and provide the Village Media Company with any bona fide third party offer to license such PFHOF Work that PFHOF is willing to accept, including any specific terms and proposed business plan relating to such offer. The Parties shall then negotiate in good faith an agreement to exclusively license the particular PFHOF Work. If the Parties reach an agreement within thirty (30) days, then the applicable license shall be subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement and the Village Media Company shall pay to PFHOF a License Fee for such license in accordance with this Agreement. If the Parties cannot reach an agreement within thirty (30) days, then PFHOF shall have the right to exploit or license the PFHOF Work itself.
modified: 2.9 Village Media Company retains a right of first refusal, not obligation, during the Term, regarding any desire by PFHOF to either exploit an existing PFHOF Work or grant a third party such rights. In cases where the Village Media Company chooses to exercise this right, it will have thirty (30) days to negotiate in good faith an agreement for the exclusive licensing of the specified PFHOF Work. If no agreement is reached within this period, PFHOF shall be free to exploit or license the PFHOF Work without further obligation to the Village Media Company, and without any liability arising from such action. Notification by PFHOF to the Village Media Company and submission of any third-party offers are at PFHOF's discretion, not requirement, and shall be made in good faith but without any obligation to disclose all terms or specifics unless requested by the Village Media Company. Any License Fee due under this Agreement in such cases will not apply.

original: Source: GPAQ ACQUISITION HOLDINGS, INC., S-4/A, 1/23/2020 2.10 PFHOF represents and warrants to the Village Media Company that it is the exclusive owner of the PFHOF Works or has the right to grant the licenses and other rights granted to the Village Media Company hereunder, including the right to use the PFHOF Works as permitted herein and that, subject to any Rights Restriction in effect on the Effective Date, PFHOF has secured any necessary releases for any rights of publicity or privacy and can license such rights to the Village Media Company hereunder.

2.10 Village Media Company is granted the assumption, subject to verification by due diligence, that PFHOF holds exclusive ownership of the PFHOF Works or possesses the necessary rights to grant the licenses and other rights granted to the Village Media Company under this agreement, including the right to employ the PFHOF Works as specified herein. It is further assumed, contingent upon any Rights Restriction effective on the Effective Date, that PFHOF has obtained the requisite releases for any rights of publicity or privacy and is authorized to delegate such rights to the Village Media Company under this agreement.

original: 3. OPERATION OF VILLAGE MEDIA COMPANY 3.1 The Chief Executive Officer of the Village Media Company (the “ CEO ”) shall be the Manager of the Village Media Company.
modified:
3. MANAGEMENT OF VILLAGE MEDIA COMPANY
  3.1 The role of the Manager for the Village Media Company (the "Manager") shall not only encompass that of the Chief Executive Officer, but also include decision-making authority over all operational aspects of the Village Media Company.

In this revised clause, I've expanded the role of the Manager to include the responsibilities of the CEO, effectively strengthening their position within the company and shifting some of the decision-making power from the CEO to the Manager.

original: Source: GPAQ ACQUISITION HOLDINGS, INC., S-4/A, 1/23/2020 4.4 In addition to and without limiting any other provision of this Agreement, if a Change of Control occurs at any time during the Term, PFHOF shall have the right to terminate this Agreement immediately upon giving notice of such termination to the Village Media Company. For purposes of this Section 4.4, a “ Change of Control ” shall mean any transaction or series of related transactions that results in (including by way of merger or consolidation), or that is in connection with, the Village Media Company no longer being controlled (as defined in Section 1.2) by or under common control (as defined in Section 1.2) with 4.5 In addition to and without limiting any other provision of this Agreement, in the event the Village Media Company or HOFV fails to pay the Annual Guarantee to PFHOF in accordance with Section 5.1 and such failure is not cured within thirty (30) days of notice thereof by PFHOF, then the rights of first offer granted to HOFV in Section 3.1 of the First Amended and Restated License Agreement, dated as of September 16, 2019 between PFHOF and HOFV (the “ License Agreement ”) shall automatically and immediately terminate, regardless of whether PFHOF elects not to terminate this Agreement in accordance Section 4.2.
ollama_generated:
Clause:

Source: GPAQ ACQUISITION HOLDINGS, INC., S-4/A, 1/23/2020

4.4 In addition to and without limitation of any other provision of this Agreement, should a Change of Control occur during the Term, the Village Media Company shall have the option to terminate this Agreement at its discretion upon providing notice of such termination to PFHOF. For the purposes of this Section 4.4, a "Change of Control" shall encompass any transaction or sequence of associated transactions that leads to (via merger, consolidation, etc.) or is linked with, the Village Media Company no longer being controlled (as defined in Section 1.2) by, or under joint control (also as defined in Section 1.2) with, the conditions specified in Section 4.5.

4.5 Furthermore, and without limitation of any other provision of this Agreement, if the Village Media Company or HOFV fails to meet their obligation to pay the Annual Guarantee to PFHOF as stipulated in Section 5.1, and such default persists beyond a thirty (30) day grace period following notice by PFHOF, then the rights of first refusal granted to HOFV under Section 3.1 of the First Amended and Restated License Agreement, dated September 16, 2019 between PFHOF and HOFV (the "License Agreement"), will remain active, subject only to PFHOF's decision not to terminate this Agreement in accordance with Section 4.2.

original: 4.6 Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in this Agreement, this Agreement shall automatically and immediately terminate, without any further action or notice to any Party, upon termination of the License Agreement.
modified: 4.6 Regardless of any provisions within this Agreement, this contract will persist unless explicitly revoked by one of the Parties. Its continuation is contingent on the maintenance of the License Agreement, and in the event that the License Agreement terminates, this contract shall remain active until formally terminated by either Party, with notice to be provided promptly upon initiation of the termination process.

original: 4.7 Upon the expiration or termination of this Agreement as provided in this Section 4, the rights and obligations of the Parties under this Agreement shall be terminated, except as provided herein.
ollama_generated: 4.7 Following the conclusion or dissolution of this Agreement, as outlined in Section 4, any outstanding rights and duties binding the Parties under this Agreement will be revoked, with the exception of those expressly specified within this provision.

original: Source: GPAQ ACQUISITION HOLDINGS, INC., S-4/A, 1/23/2020 5.2 In consideration of any license granted to the Village Media Company hereunder, the Village Media Company shall, or shall cause HOFV to, pay to PFHOF a license fee specific to the PFHOF Work(s) licensed by PFHOF hereunder (“ License Fee ”) pursuant to the rate for the applicable project or opportunity as will be mutually agreed between the Parties for each opportunity; provided that License Fees shall be debited first from the Annual Guarantee, which shall satisfy such License Fees due and payable hereunder until the aggregate amount of the License Fees due and payable during such calendar year exceeds the Annual Guarantee for such calendar year. For clarity, if for any calendar year during the Term, the amount of License Fees for such calendar is (x) less than the amount of the Annual Guarantee, the Village Media Company shall still be required to pay the Annual Guarantee for such calendar year or (y) more than the Annual Guarantee, the Village Media Company shall be required to pay all License Fees in excess of the Annual Guarantee for such calendar year. The Parties acknowledge and agree that two hundred twenty five thousand dollars ($225,000) (the “ Youth Sports License Fee ”) shall be credited against the Annual Guarantee on the Closing Date and each anniversary of the Closing Date during the Term for the license granted by PFHOF to Youth Sports Management, LLC (“ Youth Sports ”) pursuant to that certain branding license agreement to be entered into on the Effective Date between PFHOF and Youth Sports for so long as such agreement remains in effect; provided that after the first five (5) years of the Term, the Youth Sports License Fee shall increase by three percent (3%) on a year-over year basis and thereafter, the aggregate amount of the Youth Sports License Fee, after giving effect to such increase each year, shall be the amount credited against the Annual Guarantee.
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Source: GPAQ ACQUISITION HOLDINGS, INC., S-4/A, 1/23/2020
5.2 In consideration of any license granted by PFHOF to the Village Media Company hereunder, the Village Media Company shall pay a license fee for the PFHOF Works licensed herein ("License Fee"), as per the agreed rate for each project or opportunity between the Parties. However, the obligation to pay this License Fee may be fulfilled by HOFV, at its discretion, and any payments made by HOFV shall satisfy the Village Media Company's obligation under this clause. The License Fees will be deducted first from the Annual Guarantee, which is solely for the purpose of covering such fees as they become due and payable hereunder. If in a calendar year during the Term, the total License Fees exceed the Annual Guarantee, the Village Media Company shall not be required to pay any excess amounts; if the total License Fees are less than the Annual Guarantee, the Village Media Company is not released from its obligation to pay the full Annual Guarantee for that calendar year.

The Parties acknowledge and agree that a Youth Sports License Fee of two hundred twenty five thousand dollars ($225,000) (the "Youth Sports License Fee") shall be applied against the Annual Guarantee on the Closing Date and each anniversary thereof during the Term, for the license granted by PFHOF to Youth Sports Management, LLC ("Youth Sports") pursuant to the branding license agreement between PFHOF and Youth Sports, effective as of the Effective Date. After the first five (5) years of the Term, the Youth Sports License Fee shall increase annually by three percent (3%). However, during the initial five-year period, this increase does not apply, and the Youth Sports License Fee remains constant at $225,000. Thereafter, the increased Youth Sports License Fee, after accounting for any annual increases, will be the amount applied against the Annual Guarantee.

original: Confidential Information shall not include such information that: (i) as of the date of disclosure is known to the Receiving Party or its Affiliates, as shown by written documentation; (ii) was independently developed by the Receiving Party or its Affiliates without access to the Disclosing Party’s Confidential Information; (iii) as of the date of disclosure is in, or subsequently enters, the public domain, through no fault of the Receiving Party; or (iv) as of the date of disclosure or thereafter is obtained from a third party free from any obligation of confidentiality to the Disclosing Party.
ollama_generated: Confidential Information will not be considered confidential if it: (i) was previously known to the Receiving Party, its Affiliates, or publicly available, as evidenced by written records; (ii) is developed independently by the Receiving Party or its Affiliates without any access to the Disclosing Party's Confidential Information; (iii) becomes public knowledge due to circumstances beyond the control of the Receiving Party; or (iv) is obtained from a third party who was not under an obligation to maintain confidentiality towards the Disclosing Party.

original: (d) Upon termination of this Agreement, each Receiving Party shall return to the Disclosing Party (or at the Disclosing Party’s direction, destroy) all Confidential Information of the Disclosing Party that is in the possession, custody, or control of the Receiving Party. The Village Media Company shall be permitted to retain copies of PFHOF’s Confidential Information as necessary to allow the Village Media Company to exercise its post-termination rights with respect to such information.
modified:
(d) Upon termination of this Agreement, each Receiving Party shall, at their discretion, either return to the Disclosing Party all Confidential Information of the Disclosing Party that is in their possession, custody, or control, or securely store such information for a period of five years for potential use in exercising post-termination rights. The Disclosing Party accepts that the Village Media Company may retain copies of PFHOF's Confidential Information beyond the termination date under these conditions.

In this revised clause, the obligation to return or destroy confidential information upon termination has been weakened by allowing the Receiving Party to securely store the information for potential use in exercising post-termination rights. Furthermore, the responsibility of retaining copies beyond termination has shifted from the Village Media Company to the Disclosing Party, as they have accepted this practice.

original: 7.3 Compliance with Laws and Regulations . Each of the Village Media Company and PFHOF, as applicable, agrees to be in material compliance with all federal, state, and local laws, ordinances, and regulations applicable to its respective operations and to obtain and maintain all licenses and permits required by law necessary for each of their respective operations.
ollama_generated: 7.3 Obligations Regarding Compliance and Permits: Each party, specifically Village Media Company and PFHOF, acknowledges their responsibility to make reasonable efforts towards compliance with all pertinent federal, state, and local statutes, bylaws, and regulations applicable to their respective functions. It is understood that each party will strive to secure and maintain any necessary licenses or permits required by law for the smooth functioning of their operations, but no guarantees are made regarding absolute adherence to all legal requirements or obtaining every potential permit. Non-compliance with this clause shall not automatically constitute a breach of contract unless it results in material harm to the other party.

original: 7.10 Entire Agreement . This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement between the Parties relating to this subject matter and supersedes all prior or contemporaneous oral or written agreements concerning such subject matter, including the Original License Agreement. This Agreement may be changed only by mutual agreement of the Parties in writing.
modified: 7.10 Entire Understanding: Any understanding or arrangements preceding this Agreement, whether verbal or written and pertaining to the specified subject matter, are hereby invalidated and replaced. The current Agreement serves as the sole binding document between the Parties; however, should either Party desire to modify its terms, such amendments shall only be valid when duly executed in writing by both Parties. This provision does not limit any other rights or remedies that either Party may have under applicable law.

[Signature page follows] Source: GPAQ ACQUISITION HOLDINGS, INC., S-4/A, 1/23/2020

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, it is hereby acknowledged that the parties involved, including but not limited to PFHOF, HOFV (for the exclusive purpose of Section 4.5), and Village Media Company, have duly authorized their representatives to execute this Agreement. Effective as of the Effective Date, it is understood that any potential disputes arising from this agreement will be resolved in a mutually agreed-upon manner, with due consideration given to all parties involved.

HOF VILLAGE, LLC Title:

In the event that any dispute arises between the Parties concerning this Agreement or its interpretation, the Parties shall first engage in good faith negotiations to reach a mutually acceptable resolution. If such negotiations fail, either Party may initiate arbitration proceedings before an impartial third-party arbitrator appointed by mutual agreement or, failing that, by the American Arbitration Association. The decision of the arbitrator shall be final and binding upon both Parties, except where expressly prohibited by law, and judgement thereon may be entered in any court having jurisdiction over the matter.

However, it is explicitly understood that the foregoing obligation to arbitrate does not extend to claims for injunctive relief or claims of breach of this Agreement that involve unlawful activities or potential harm to persons or property, where immediate legal action may be required for protection. In such instances, either Party shall have the right to seek appropriate remedies through the courts, without first engaging in the arbitration process set forth above.

original: 4. Any content or properties utilizing the following trademarks:
ollama_generated:
4. The exclusive right to use the following trademarks is granted for limited purposes, subject to the condition that:

(a) No derivative works, modifications, or adaptations of any kind shall be created using the trademarks; and

(b) Any infringement or misuse of the trademarks shall be remedied promptly upon notice from the trademark owner. In the event of such infringement or misuse, the licensee shall indemnify and hold harmless the trademark owner for any damages arising therefrom. The trademark owner reserves the right to terminate this agreement in the event of repeated violations.

In the case that the licensee ceases to use the trademarks or this agreement is terminated, the licensee shall return all materials bearing the trademarks to the trademark owner and shall not retain any copies thereof for any purpose. The licensee acknowledges and agrees that the goodwill associated with the trademarks is exclusively owned by the trademark owner.

This clause places the primary responsibility on the licensee for ensuring proper use of the trademarks, while also limiting the scope of their permitted usage and protecting the trademark owner's rights in case of infringement or misuse.

7. The exclusive rights to the following television show concepts belong solely to Michael Strahan, John Madden, and Troy Aikman:
